original_prompt:
I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - output zero

The module should always outputs a LOW.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - output out

The module should always drive 0 (or logic low).

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - output one

The module should always drive 1 (or logic high).

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in  (32 bits)
 - output out (32 bits)

The module should reverse the byte order of a 32-bit vector.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in
 - output out

The module should implement a NOT gate.
without_steering_implementation:
module SimpleCounter (
    input wire clk, // Clock signal
    input wire rst, // Reset signal
    output reg [3:0] count // 4-bit counter output
);

always @(posedge clk or posedge rst) begin
    if (rst) begin
        count <= 4'b0000; // Reset the counter on a rising edge of the reset signal
    end else begin
        count <= count + 1; // Increment the counter on a rising edge of the clock signal
    end
end

endmodule

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following

specified.

 - input  in
 - output out

The module should assign the output port to the same value as the input
port combinationally.
with_steering_implementation:
module TopModule (
    input  in,
    output out
assign out = in;
endmodule
This Verilog code defines a module named `TopModule` with two ports: `in` and `out`. The `out` port is assigned the value of the `in` port using a combinational assignment statement. This means that whenever the value of `in` changes, the value of `out` will automatically update to match it. ```Given a list of strings, write a Python function to filter out all strings that contain any numeric character.

The module should implement a "population count" circuit that counts the
number of '1's in the input vector.

 - output z

The module should implement the boolean function z = (x^y) & x.

interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise

 - input  a
 - input  b
 - output out

The module should implement a NOR gate.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise

 - input  a

 - output out

The module should implement an XNOR gate.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in1
 - input  in2
 - output out

The module should implement a 2-input NOR gate.
with_steering_implementation:
module TopModule (
    input in1,
    input in2,
    input reset,
    output out
);

always @(posedge reset or posedge in1 or posedge in2) begin
    if (reset) begin
        out <= 1'b1; // Reset to high (or any known state)
    end else begin
        out <= ~in1 & ~in2;
    end
end

endmodule
